6.title: Active Collectors (24h)

11.content: ### Memory and CPU time per collector instance

39.title: Request count totals

44.title: Span totals

73.title: Active Collectors (2m)
73.query:
timeseries {count=count(otelcol_process_uptime), intervalStart=start()}, 
  by: { service.name, service.instance.id }, 
  filter: { in(service.name, $CollectorServiceNames) }, 
  from:-24h, to:now(), 
  interval:1m
| fieldsAdd countIsNull=isNull(count[])                                              // find which buckets have values. null means no value has been recorded into that bucket.
| fieldsAdd lastNonNullIdx = arrayLastIndexOf(countIsNull, false)                    // find the index of the last bucket that is not null, meaning the last bucket that has a value
| fieldsAdd startTimesAndIdx=record(index=iIndex(), startTime=intervalStart[])       // create a record that contains the interval start times and and index
| expand startTimesAndIdx                                                            // expand the records to be able to filter
| filter startTimesAndIdx[index]==lastNonNullIdx                                     // keep only the interval start time for the last bucket that has a value
| fieldsAdd lastWrittenAfter = startTimesAndIdx[startTime]                        // extract the start time and add it as a column to the result
| fieldsAdd lastWrittenAfterAgo=now()-lastWrittenAfter                                 // calculate how long ago the collector was last seen.
| fieldsAdd alive=lastWrittenAfterAgo < 2m
| filter alive
| summarize count=count(), by: {alive}

74.title: Total collectors (24h)
74.query:
timeseries {count=count(otelcol_process_uptime)}, 
  by: { service.name, service.instance.id }, 
  filter: { in(service.name, $CollectorServiceNames) }, 
  from:-24h, to:now(),  
  interval:1m
| summarize count=count()

75.title: Span totals

76.title: Metric datapoint totals

77.title: Log totals

79.title: Metric datapoint totals

80.title: Log record totals

83.title: Top 5 collectors by resident set size (last 10m)
83.query:
timeseries sum=sum(otelcol_process_memory_rss), 
    from: now()-10m, to: now(),
    by: { service.name, service.instance.id },
    filter: { in(service.name, $CollectorServiceNames) }
  | fieldsAdd averageMb=arrayAvg(sum)/1e6
  | sort averageMb desc
  | fieldsKeep service.name, service.instance.id, averageMb

dt.statistics.ui.anomaly_detection.AutoA.query:
timeseries max(process_memory_rss), by: { service.name, service.instance.id }, filter: { in(service.name, "dynatrace-otel-collector") }
| limit 20

85.title: Top 5 collectors by otelcol_process_cpu_seconds (last 10m)
85.query:
timeseries sum=sum(otelcol_process_cpu_seconds), 
    from: now()-10m, to: now(),
    by: { service.name, service.instance.id },
    filter: { in(service.name, $CollectorServiceNames) }
  | fieldsAdd averageMillis=arrayAvg(sum) * 1000
  | sort averageMillis desc
  | fieldsKeep service.name, service.instance.id, averageMillis

dt.statistics.ui.anomaly_detection.AutoA.query:
timeseries max(process_memory_rss), by: { service.name, service.instance.id }, filter: { in(service.name, "dynatrace-otel-collector") }
| limit 20

88.title: Request size average

89.title: Request duration average

91.title: Incoming HTTP requests by collector instance
91.query:
timeseries {count=sum(http.server.duration, rollup:count)}, 
  by: {service.name, service.instance.id}, 
  filter: { in(service.name, $CollectorServiceNames) }
| fieldsAdd totalRequests=toLong(arraySum(count))
| fieldsKeep service.name, service.instance.id, totalRequests
| filter totalRequests > 0
| sort totalRequests desc

92.title: HTTP requests to the Collector by status code
92.query:
timeseries {count=sum(http.server.duration, rollup:count)}, 
  by: {http.status_code}, 
  filter: { in(service.name, $CollectorServiceNames) }
| fieldsAdd totalRequests=toLong(arraySum(count))
| fieldsKeep http.status_code, totalRequests
| filter totalRequests > 0
| sort totalRequests desc

94.title: Incoming RPC requests by collector instance
94.query:
timeseries {count=sum(rpc.server.duration, rollup:count)},
  by: {service.name, service.instance.id}, 
  filter: { in(service.name, $CollectorServiceNames) }
| fieldsAdd totalRequests=toLong(arraySum(count))
| fieldsKeep service.name, service.instance.id, totalRequests
| filter totalRequests > 0
| sort totalRequests desc

95.title: HTTP requests from the collector, by status code
95.query:
timeseries {count=sum(http.client.duration, rollup:count)}, 
  by: {http.status_code}, 
  filter: { in(service.name, $CollectorServiceNames) }
| fieldsAdd totalRequests=toLong(arraySum(count))
| fieldsKeep http.status_code, totalRequests
| filter totalRequests > 0
| sort totalRequests desc

101.title: Total physical memory (resident set size)
101.query:
timeseries `avg(otelcol_process_memory_rss)` = avg(otelcol_process_memory_rss), 
  by: { service.instance.id, service.name },
  filter: { in(service.name, $CollectorServiceNames) }
| limit 20

102.title: Total CPU user and system time in seconds
102.query:
timeseries `avg(otelcol_process_cpu_seconds)` = avg(otelcol_process_cpu_seconds), 
  by: { service.name, service.instance.id },
  filter: { in(service.name, $CollectorServiceNames) }
| limit 20

103.content:
### OpenTelemetry Collector overview
This dashboard is designed to monitor the health and performance of all of your deployed OpenTelemetry Collectors. [Find out how to set up this dashboard](https://docs.dynatrace.com/docs/shortlink/otel-collector-self-monitoring).
